intro: Cryptantha affinis var. flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its flexible stems allow it to bend and resist wind damage, adapting well to its arid environment. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
